intro: Eustephia, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are native to regions of Europe, North Africa, and western Asia, often growing in rocky or arid environments. Eustephia species are characterized by their erect stems, small leaves, and showy, often pink or white flowers. They typically bloom in spring or early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
